CreateFHIRDatastore.name: CreateFHIRDatastore
CreateFHIRDatastore.documentation: Creates a datastore that can ingest and export FHIR data.

DescribeFHIRDatastore.name: DescribeFHIRDatastore
DescribeFHIRDatastore.documentation: Gets the properties associated with the FHIR datastore, including the datastore ID, datastore ARN, datastore name, datastore status, created at, datastore type version, and datastore endpoint.

DescribeFHIRImportJob.name: DescribeFHIRImportJob
DescribeFHIRImportJob.documentation: Displays the properties of a FHIR import job, including the ID, ARN, name, and the status of the datastore.

ListFHIRDatastores.name: ListFHIRDatastores
ListFHIRDatastores.documentation: Lists all FHIR datastores that are in the user’s account, regardless of datastore status.

DatastoreName.documentation: The user generated name for the datastore.

DatastoreTypeVersion.documentation: The FHIR version of the datastore. The only supported version is R4.

PreloadDataConfig.documentation: Optional parameter to preload data upon creation of the datastore. Currently, the only supported preloaded data is synthetic data generated from Synthea.

ClientToken.documentation: Optional user provided token used for ensuring idempotency.

DatastoreId.documentation: The AWS-generated datastore id. This id is in the output from the initial datastore creation call.

DatastoreArn.documentation: The datastore ARN is generated during the creation of the datastore and can be found in the output from the initial datastore creation call.

DatastoreStatus.documentation: The status of the FHIR datastore. Possible statuses are ‘CREATING’, ‘ACTIVE’, ‘DELETING’, ‘DELETED’.

DatastoreEndpoint.documentation: The AWS endpoint for the created datastore. For preview, only US-east-1 endpoints are supported.

DatastoreName.documentation: Allows the user to filter datastore results by name.

DatastoreStatus.documentation: Allows the user to filter datastore results by status.

CreatedBefore.documentation: A filter that allows the user to set cutoff dates for records. All datastores created before the specified date will be included in the results.

CreatedAfter.documentation: A filter that allows the user to set cutoff dates for records. All datastores created after the specified date will be included in the results.

DatastoreId.documentation: The AWS-generated ID number for the datastore.

DatastoreArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name used in the creation of the datastore.

DatastoreStatus.documentation: The status of the datastore. Possible statuses are 'CREATING', 'ACTIVE', 'DELETING', or 'DELETED'.

CreatedAt.documentation: The time that a datastore was created.

DatastoreTypeVersion.documentation: The FHIR version. Only R4 version data is supported.

DatastoreEndpoint.documentation: The AWS endpoint for the datastore. Each datastore will have it's own endpoint with datastore ID in the endpoint URL.

PreloadDataConfig.documentation: The preloaded data configuration for the datastore. Only data preloaded from Synthea is supported.

DatastoreProperties.documentation: Displays the properties of the datastore, including the ID, Arn, name, and the status of the datastore.

DatastoreId.documentation: The AWS-generated ID for the datastore to be deleted.
The AWS-generated ID for the datastore to be deleted.

DatastoreArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that gives Amazon HealthLake access permission.

DatastoreStatus.documentation: The status of the datastore that the user has requested to be deleted.

DatastoreEndpoint.documentation: The AWS endpoint for the datastore the user has requested to be deleted.

DatastoreId.documentation: The AWS-generated datastore id. This is part of the ‘CreateFHIRDatastore’ output.

DatastoreProperties.documentation: All properties associated with a datastore, including the datastore ID, datastore ARN, datastore name, datastore status, created at, datastore type version, and datastore endpoint.

ImportJobProperties.documentation: The properties of the Import job request, including the ID, ARN, name, and the status of the datastore.

JobId.documentation: The AWS-generated id number for the Import job.

JobName.documentation: The user-generated name for an Import job.

JobStatus.documentation: The job status for an Import job. Possible statuses are SUBMITTED, IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETED, FAILED.

SubmitTime.documentation: The time that the Import job was submitted for processing.

EndTime.documentation: The time that the Import job was completed.

DatastoreId.documentation: The datastore id used when the Import job was created.

InputDataConfig.documentation: The input data configuration that was supplied when the Import job was created.

DataAccessRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that gives Amazon HealthLake access to your input data.

Message.documentation: An explanation of any errors that may have occurred during the FHIR import job.

ImportJobProperties.documentation: Displays the properties of the import job, including the ID, Arn, Name, and the status of the datastore.

S3Uri.documentation: The S3Uri is the user specified S3 location of the FHIR data to be imported into Amazon HealthLake.

InputDataConfig.documentation: The input properties for an import job.

Filter.documentation: Lists all filters associated with a FHIR datastore request.

NextToken.documentation: Fetches the next page of datastores when results are paginated.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of datastores returned in a single page of a ListFHIRDatastoresRequest call.

DatastorePropertiesList.documentation: All properties associated with the listed datastores.

NextToken.documentation: Pagination token that can be used to retrieve the next page of results.

PreloadDataType.documentation: The type of preloaded data. Only Synthea preloaded data is supported.

PreloadDataConfig.documentation: The input properties for the preloaded datastore. Only data preloaded from Synthea is supported.

JobName.documentation: The name of the FHIR Import job in the StartFHIRImport job request.

InputDataConfig.documentation: The input properties of the FHIR Import job in the StartFHIRImport job request.

DataAccessRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that gives Amazon HealthLake access permission.

ClientToken.documentation: Optional user provided token used for ensuring idempotency.

documentation: Amazon HealthLake is a HIPAA eligibile service that allows customers to store, transform, query, and analyze their data in a consistent fashion in the cloud.
